title: Increasing Federal Employment of Individuals With Disabilities

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to actively recruit, hire, and retain individuals with disabilities to increase their representation in the federal workforce. It establishes goals, accountability measures, and strategies to improve employment opportunities for people with disabilities and to support their successful return to work if injured on the job.
potential_concerns: The focus on increasing hiring of individuals with disabilities may lead to perceptions of preferential treatment or reverse discrimination among other federal employees, potentially impacting workplace morale.
Insufficient resources or funding for reasonable accommodations and accessible technologies might limit the effectiveness of retention efforts for federal employees with disabilities.

Despite the emphasis on recruitment and retention, agencies might lack the expertise or incentives to fully implement the plans, resulting in minimal improvements for individuals with disabilities seeking federal employment.
Privacy concerns may arise for individuals with disabilities regarding voluntary self-identification and disclosure of disability status during hiring and employment retention processes.
